intro: Lesquerella montana, commonly known as mountain lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant produces distinctive seed pods that contain a waxy substance called lesquerol, which has industrial applications. Lesquerella montana typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, thriving in full sun. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and nectar for pollinators in its native range.
